whatever happens whatever political

who may have different views but will

this is an attack on the established way

like our values people who do not

will not stop or will get in the way of

that's what david bond a great

jolly friendly

what we will always do is take security

what david was doing today i've done

what we've got to do is rally around

what we won't do

what we've got we've got to get it right
it's not about a nature reaction of what

is we are continuously
looking upgrading seeing what more

by mps to carry out their duties the

and it's always being reviewed what i've
got to say is
this is shock this is horror we're all

is
that david believed in the commons he

that that is a priority but as i say

they will not win
and we won't let them win but i do say

it will continue

many mps have been changing their
arrangements in recent years they've
ensured that they're never unaccompanied

publishing publicizing their whereabouts
too far in advance in sir david ames
case he'd been advised by police to

well but the provision of armed
detectives is preserved for certain
ministers and those under very high risk

a balance between safety and
accessibility but both the home

today is hardly an isolated incident
this isn't the first time a british

the killing of joe cox in 2016 was the

in terms of how we respond in parliament
um certainly we have to be careful
but i think that it's important we
recognize that a central element
of our democracy
is that accessibility that the public
have to their elected member of

important to recognize
that as members of parliament we're out

occasions and events i mean tomorrow i'm

and so i think when we're looking at

rather than just for surgeries
but certainly what i've noticed in my

is a lot more aggressive
and i've met some of the people who've

and i've said we can try and have an

and they say that the language they're

is to some people normal
and that we need to be careful of

it happens worse to women than to men
